str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From diakonos; to be an attendant, i.e. Wait upon (figuratively) teacher; technically, to act as a Christian deacon.
Well, nobly, honorably, rightly. Adverb from kalos; well.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To acquire, earn, purchase, make my own, preserve alive.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
A step (of a stairway); hence: a stage in a career, a position. From the same as bathos; a step, i.e. grade.
From pas and a derivative of rheo; all out-spokenness, i.e. Frankness, bluntness, publicity; by implication, assurance.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
